questions.text: A 35-year-old male patient is brought to the ER after sustaining trauma to his spine during a car accident. The bystanders reported that he was not found wearing a seatbelt. Examination reveals weakness in motor movements on the right side with hyperactive reflexes. Suspecting Brown-Sequard syndrome, which of the following clinical findings will be observed in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Contralateral loss of joint sense and position

options.label: C
options.text: Ipsilateral loss of complete sensory functions

questions.correct_answer: B. Contralateral loss of pain sensation
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Contralateral loss of pain sensation

questions.text: A 40-year-old truck driver who has been in a long-distance relationship with his wife for the last 5 years, came to the OPD with complaints of weakness jaundice and loss of appetite. His viral markers were done which are given below: HbSAg + HbeAg – HBV DNA + IgG anti HbCAg + HIV viral load 65000 copies/mL CD4 T cell count 320 cells/microliter Which of the following drugs can be prescribed to this patient?

A 45-year-old patient presents with a history of recurrent kidney stones. A urine specimen was collected and subjected to microscopic examination. The results revealed several findings, including the one shown below. Additionally, there were signs of red blood cells and white blood cells in the urine. What is the finding that is not seen in the urine of this patient?
What is the nerve that passes through the marked foramen in the image below?
Identify the marked area in the given spirometry graph?
Below is a partogram depicting a woman in labor, and oxytocin infusion has been given. Please indicate the optimal management for the patient.

A 75-year-old man is brought in by his wife for increasingly bizarre behavior over the last year. She reports that her husband does not recognize her as his wife, but instead believes that she is an impostor who looks exactly like her. He also has the same reaction towards their pet dog, accusing it of being replaced with an identical-looking dog. His medical history is significant for type 2 diabetes and hypertension. Neurologic examination reveals normal motor and sensory function. Which type of dementia is most likely associated with the patient's condition?

A 60-year-old patient with hypertension has been prescribed an allosteric modifier as part of their treatment plan. The medication is intended to regulate the activity of an enzyme involved in blood pressure regulation. Which of the following statements is true regarding the allosteric modifier prescribed to this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Causes the enzyme to work faster only

questions.text: A patient presents with acute chest pain for which he was given sublingual Nitroglycerin. His pain was relieved in 5 minutes. What is the likely mechanism of action of this drug?

A pregnant woman arrives at the outpatient department during her 36th week of gestation, reporting breathlessness and significant abdominal distension. During the examination, fetal movements are found to be normal, but fetal parts are not easily palpable, and a muffled fetal heartbeat is detected. The measurement of the symphysis fundal height indicates it to be 41 cm. Upon abdominal examination, the abdomen is found to be tense but not tender. What can be the most likely diagnosis?

A 32-year-old farmer experienced a sudden loss of consciousness while working in the field, after which he was brought to the emergency room. During examination, the patient displayed a body temperature of 105 degrees Fahrenheit and reduced skin turgor. Among the listed options, which of the following would not be observed in this patient?
Which nerve provides innervation to the structure indicated in the image below?

A 31-year-old woman at 25 weeks’ gestation with twins presented with urticarial plaques & blisters over her abdomen & inner thighs. She had been feeling increasingly itchy for 2-3 weeks prior to her presentation and then developed blisters for which she had been prescribed clobetasol propionate 0.05% ointment by her GP with no effect. She had a history of itching in the third trimester of her previous pregnancies. On examination, she had several large bullae on her abdomen & each thigh as shown in the image below. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 7-year-old male child, weighing 29 kg, is brought to OPD with a category 3 wound after a dog bite. Currently, equine rabies immunoglobulin is available instead of human rabies immunoglobulin. What dosage should be given as post-exposure prophylaxis for this child?

A patient was brought to the ER with alleged history of consumption of 10 digoxin tablets. On clinical examination, he was found unstable with a heart rate of 50 beats per minute. ECG was done which is shown below. What is the next best step in the management of this patient?

A 35-year-old patient is admitted to the hospital with symptoms of persistent hypertension, severe headaches, and excessive sweating. The doctor in-charge suspects an underlying disorder and decides to perform a urine vanillyl mandelic acid (VMA) excretion test of the patient for the same. The test is positive in which of the following conditions?
Under what circumstances can hysteroscopy be performed?

After sleeping with the arm positioned under the head overnight, the individual now encounters a condition of paresis in the morning, characterized by muscle weakness, without any accompanying numbness. What could be the most suitable explanation for this phenomenon?

options.label: A
options.text: C fibers are more sensitive to pressure than A fibers.

options.label: B
options.text: A fibers are more sensitive to hypoxia than B fibers.

options.label: C
options.text: A fibers are more susceptible to pressure changes than C fibers.

options.label: D
options.text: A fibers are more susceptible to hypoxia than C fibers.

questions.correct_answer: C. A fibers are more susceptible to pressure changes than C fibers.
questions.explanation: Ans. C. A fibers are more susceptible to pressure changes than C fibers

questions.text: A 30-year-old male patient presents to the OPD with chin protrusion, excessive sweating, impaired glucose tolerance, and hand and foot enlargement. Which of the following is a growth hormone receptor antagonist used to treat this condition?

A 45-year-old patient visits the clinic with a complaint of progressive vision loss. Further evaluation reveals a radiological finding of an aneurysm near the optic chiasma. This aneurysm is believed to be exerting pressure and causing damage. In your diagnosis, which specific artery is the likely culprit behind this aneurysm, leading to the visual impairment?

A 60-year-old woman presents with a history of blurred vision and eye pain in her left eye for the past few months. On examination, the ophthalmologist notes a pigmented lesion on the iris with irregular borders and a raised appearance. The pupil is slightly distorted, and there is mild dilation of the pupil. The intraocular pressure is within normal limits. The remainder of the exam is unremarkable . A T1 weighted MRI is shown here. What is the diagnosis?

A 10-year-old patient is brought to the hospital by their parents due to persistent symptoms of liver dysfunction, jaundice, and a failure to thrive. The medical team suspects a metabolic disorder and decides to perform further investigations. Which of the following clinical conditions is associated with a defective fumaryl-acetoacetate hydrolase enzyme in this patient?

A primigravida presents to you during the early stages of her pregnancy. The ultrasound confirms she is 7 weeks pregnant, and her hemoglobin level is 9 g/dL. At what point should she begin taking iron supplements?
Which of the following monoclonal antibodies is NOT correctly paired with its target?
All of the following features are features of pseudohallucinations, except?

options.label: B
options.text: They are perceived in the objective space

options.label: D
options.text: They are not under the control of the patient

questions.correct_answer: B. They are perceived in the objective space
questions.explanation: Ans. B. They are perceived in the objective space

questions.text: A 52-year-old female patient visits the clinic with complaints of a foul-smelling bloody discharge from the vagina, accompanied by mucous discharge. Upon examination, a necrotizing growth is observed in the cervix, and it appears to have spread to the lateral parametrium. What would be the appropriate course of action for managing this patient's condition?

A newborn baby has been refusing breast milk since the 2 nd day of birth but accepts glucose water. On the 6 th day, the baby develops vomiting and severe jaundice. Urine tested positive with Benedict's reagent, and blood glucose levels were found to be low. What is the most probable cause of these symptoms in the newborn baby?
A 30-year-old woman presented to the OPD with symptoms of urinary tract infection. She was prescribed a drug that causes tendon rupture and arthropathy. What is the mechanism of action of the drug?

The patient under consideration is a pregnant woman who is at 34 weeks of amenorrhea. Her medical results reveal the following: LDH - 700 IU/L, platelets - 75,000/ mm3, serum bilirubin - 1.5 mg/dL, SGOT - 200 U/L, SGPT - 150 U/L, and BP - 140/96 mm Hg. Notably, her coagulation profile and renal function tests show normal values. Based on these findings, what would be the appropriate diagnosis for this case?
What mechanism is observed in the baroreceptor reflex?
What is the characteristic of venous blood flow of lower limb on doppler?
Which of the following drugs is associated with QT prolongation?

A woman at 26 weeks of gestation presents for routine evaluation. During the examination, the measurement of the fundal height indicates a size consistent with 24 weeks of gestation. Additionally, an ultrasound examination reveals reduced levels of amniotic fluid. What could be the possible reasons behind this particular presentation?

You are a junior resident in the Pharmacology department of the AIIMS New Delhi where your SR asks you the name of the drug which acts by causing both decreased bone resorption and increased bone formation. Which of the following will be the correct response?

A 30-year-old 70 kg man who presents to the emergency department with symptoms of weakness, dizziness, and confusion. The healthcare team suspects hyponatremia based on his clinical presentation and laboratory results which showed serum Na+ of 120 meq/litre. Calculate the patient's sodium deficit.
What is the typical FiO2 (Fraction of Inspired Oxygen) delivered by a non-rebreathing mask?

A 25-year-old businessman has presented to the OPD with the complaints of painful swelling over the great toe of his right foot. His personal history reveals that he is an alcoholic. His serum uric acid levels are found to be raised. He has been prescribed a drug which inhibits the migration of granulocytes. Identify this drug.

A 35-year-old woman is examined, presenting with lens subluxation and cognitive delay. She exhibits physical characteristics suggestive of Marfan syndrome. There is also a family history of similar symptoms among her sisters. She has been diagnosed with classical homocystinuria. Considering her condition, what dietary supplement would be most beneficial in reducing her risk of heart attacks?

A 7-year-old boy was brought to the hospital with multiple fractures of the humerus secondary to a fall from height. On examination, there is difficulty in flexion of the elbow and supination of the forearm, and associated loss of sensation over the lateral aspect of the forearm. Which nerve is most likely to be injured?

The patient in the post-operative ward is a 22-year-old with type 1 diabetes mellitus who underwent a cesarean section due to a failed induction for preeclampsia with severe features. She is currently experiencing drowsiness and altered mental status. Her treatment includes a continuous infusion of magnesium sulfate and intravenous insulin. Upon examination, her pulse rate is 70 beats per minute, blood pressure measures 140/98 mmHg, and respiratory rate is 10 breaths per minute. Lung auscultation reveals normal air entry bilaterally, while abdominal examination shows a firm uterus with normal tenderness, an intact Pfannenstiel scar, and no significant vaginal bleeding. However, both patellar reflexes are absent. Notably, a urine dipstick test for protein and sugar is negative, but her capillary glucose level measures 270 mg%. What can be the suspected diagnosis?
Match the following according to the fever with rash day wise?
Identify the type of hymen shown in the image?

A first-year Orthopedic Postgraduate develops a crush on a female intern who is posted in his ward. Despite his feelings, he finds himself being overly strict with her and reprimands her for minor mistakes while overlooking similar errors made by other interns. Which defense mechanism is he primarily using?
A 2 days old newborn was brought to OPD for a routine examination. Femoral pulses were feeble and upper limb pulses were bounding with high blood pressure. What can be the diagnosis?
What would be your advice for a patient who has undergone a vesicovaginal fistula repair?

options.label: A
options.text: Sexual abstinence for 3 months and avoid pregnancy for a year

options.label: B
options.text: Sexual abstinence for 3 weeks and avoid pregnancy for 6 months

options.label: C
options.text: Sexual abstinence for 6 weeks and avoid pregnancy for a year

options.label: D
options.text: Sexual abstinence for 6 months and avoid pregnancy for 6 years

questions.correct_answer: A. Sexual abstinence for 3 months and avoid pregnancy for a year
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Sexual abstinence for 3 months and avoid pregnancy for a year

questions.text: According to myogenic hypothesis of renal autoregulation, the afferent arterioles contract in response to stretch-induced by?
Which of the following statements is true regarding the dose-response curve shown in the image below?

options.label: B
options.text: C is more potent than A

options.label: C
options.text: B is more potent than A

questions.text: During the clinical examination of the nervous system, which of the following nerves can be tested by touching the marked structure?

A 65-year-old patient presents to the emergency department with complaints of chest pain and shortness of breath. The medical team suspects a potential cardiac issue and orders a series of blood tests, including lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) measurement. Upon reviewing the test results, it is found that the LDH ratio is flipped. What does the flipped LDH ratio imply?

A 55-year-old male patient, Mr. Subedar Singh, has a longstanding diagnosis of bipolar disorder and has been on lithium therapy for the past 5 years. He presents with complaints of excessive urination and excessive thirst for the past several weeks. His laboratory studies show normal glucose and serum electrolyte levels, and the urine output is increased without signs of infection or glucose. His lithium levels are within the therapeutic range. The patient's symptoms are most likely a side effect of his medication. Which of the following medications would be the most appropriate next step in the management of his condition?
A 5-year child present with history of fever for 6 days along with seizure. A rash develop on the trunk on the day after the fever subsides. What is the most probable diagnosis?
As an Indian medical intern, which of the following is the correct format for prescription of alprazolam?

options.label: A
options.text: Tablet alprazolam 0.5 mg once a day before bedtime for 7 days

options.label: B
options.text: Tablet alprazolam 0.5 mg HS for 7 days

options.label: C
options.text: Tablet alprazolam 500 mcg one tablet OD for 7 days

options.label: D
options.text: Tablet alprazolam ½ mg tablet HS daily

questions.correct_answer: A. Tablet alprazolam 0.5 mg once a day before bedtime for 7 days
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Tablet alprazolam 0.5 mg once a day before bedtime for 7 days

questions.text: Where are the remnants of Wolffian ducts situated in females?
Identify the cartilage given below:

During a trekking expedition, a person experiences a headache and breathlessness due to rapid ascent to an altitude exceeding 3000 meters above sea level. Which of the following is not used in treatment of the above condition?

A patient presented with jaw swelling and weight loss. Suspecting a malignancy, the submandibular gland was resected. Which is the most likely nerve to be damaged during submandibular gland resection?

A 6-month-old infant is brought to the paediatrician with the complaint of one eye larger than the other and frequent rubbing of the eyes by the baby. On examination, one of his eyes appears larger than the other with a hazy cornea and raised intraocular pressure. Suspecting Glaucoma, which of the following medications should be avoided in this infant?
Staphylococcal infection causes all the following skin diseases except?
Which of the following prostaglandins analogue is NOT correctly paired with its clinical use?
questions.correct_answer: A. Alprostadil – Closure of Ductus Arteriosus
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Alprostadil – Closure of Ductus Arteriosus

questions.text: A 30-year-old female presented with vaginal candidiasis for which she was prescribed Fluconazole. What is the mechanism of action of Fluconazole?

options.label: A
options.text: Interferes with DNA and RNA synthesis

options.label: D
options.text: Inhibits epoxidation of squalene in fungi

questions.text: Match the following:
Where does fertilization occur within the fallopian tube?

A patient came to the gynecology OPD with complaints of foul-smelling frothy vaginal discharge and severe itching. During the examination, the cervix showed a spotted appearance resembling a strawberry. What organism is responsible for this condition?

A 7-year-old child comes to the physician's office complaining of swelling and pain in the knees. His mother says, the swelling occurred for no reason, and it keeps getting worse." The initial diagnosis is Lyme disease. When talking to the mother and child, questions related to which of the following would be important to include in the initial history?

options.label: A
options.text: A decreased urinary output and flank pain

options.label: B
options.text: A fever of over 103F occurring over the last 23 weeks

options.label: C
options.text: Rashes covering the palms of the hands and the soles of the feet

questions.correct_answer: D. Headaches, malaise, or sore throat
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Headaches, malaise, or sore throat

questions.text: What is the most suitable course of action in managing a pregnant woman who is currently at 36 weeks of gestation, has mitral stenosis, and is undergoing warfarin therapy at a dosage of 4mg per day due to a prosthetic valve replacement? (LMWH- Low molecular weight heparin)

options.label: D
options.text: Stop warfarin, start LMWH and aspirin

questions.correct_answer: A. Stop warfarin and start LMWH
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Stop warfarin and start LMWH

questions.text: A 27-year-old individual was diagnosed with uterus didelphys. Among the options provided, which one is least likely to be a complication associated with this particular uterine anomaly?
Which of the following is an oral factor Xa inhibitor?
Identify the prominent nerve pointed in the given image?

A 45-year-old male presented to OPD with complaints of fatigue, weight gain, and decreased exercise tolerance over the past six months. He has noticed a decrease in muscle mass and an increase in abdominal fat deposition. He also reports experiencing frequent headaches and occasional blurred vision. The laboratory test results come back, showing low levels of IGF-I. IGF-I is synthesized by which of the following organ?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Liver

References:

  • ↳ Reference – Textbook of Medical physiology Guyton and Hall, 11 th edition, page no. 924

questions.text: A 32-year-old woman presents for her first prenatal visit at 11 weeks of gestation. On transvaginal ultrasound, a gestational sac is seen measuring 28mm in diameter, but no yolk sac or fetal pole is identified. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 68-year-old male patient has been diagnosed with Carcinoma bladder for which he was receiving chemotherapy. 4 hours later he developed intractable vomiting. Which of the following is the most effective anti-emetic that should be prescribed to this patient?

Six months ago, a woman underwent dilatation and curettage for molar pregnancy. However, she now returns with ongoing symptoms of abdominal pain and distention. After conducting a thorough evaluation, it was observed that her beta-hCG levels remained persistently elevated, and cannonball foci were detected on the chest X-ray. What would be the most suitable course of action to manage this case effectively?
During pregnancy, acute fatty liver most commonly manifests in which trimester?

A 32-year-old woman presents to the breast clinic with a painless lump in her left breast that she discovered during a self-examination. On examination, a well-defined, mobile, firm, and non-tender mass of 2 cm is palpated in the upper outer quadrant of the left breast. The overlying skin is smooth, and there is no nipple discharge or lymphadenopathy. Mammogram is shown below. Classify the following mammography lesion as per BIRADS staging:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. BIRADS 2

References:

  • ↳ Reference– Grainger & Allison’s Diagnostic Radiology Essentials, Second Edition, Page No 682

questions.text: A child presented to the clinic with complaints of recurrent infection. Physical examination shows height for age to be less than expected. The parents also have a history of Incorrect feeding method. What is the appropriate term for the above-mentioned condition?
A 55-year-old lady presented to OPD with abnormal uterine bleeding. A hysterectomy was performed and the following specimen was retrieved. What can be the diagnosis?
Which of the following is an inhibitor of DNA synthesis?
The image below depicts which of the following types of cell-to-cells signaling?
Which of the following statements regarding Theophylline is NOT correct?

options.label: A
options.text: It should not be prescribed with Erythromycin

options.label: B
options.text: Patients on theophylline develop arrythmias due to its Adenosine antagonism

options.label: C
options.text: It is a non-specific Phosphodiesterase inhibitor

options.label: D
options.text: Patients may develop diuresis due to its phosphodiesterase inhibition.

questions.correct_answer: D. Patients may develop diuresis due to its phosphodiesterase inhibition.
questions.explanation: Ans. D.  Patients may develop diuresis due to its phosphodiesterase inhibition.

questions.text: You discover that there is evidence of cardiac malformation in a fetus during a routine US scan at 16 weeks. What is the minimum level of fasting blood sugar at which you can suspect overt diabetes?

A 52-year-old patient presents with persistent gastroesophageal reflux symptoms despite medication. Upon further investigation, it's noted that the patient has a history of hiatal hernia. During an imaging study, it's revealed that certain structures are passing through the aortic opening of the diaphragm. However, one structure does not pass through this opening. Which of the mentioned structures is an exception and does not traverse through the aortic opening of the diaphragm in this patient?
The graph below shows the relationship between the log (dose) and the response of three drugs, A, B, and C. Which of these drugs has the highest potency?

A 9-year-old boy, of African descent, presented with a large boggy mass on his scalp with overlying crusting as shown in the image below. Skin scrapings and hair pluckings were taken for mycology. Microsporum canis was grown on culture. What is the most suitable treatment?
Which of the following decreases in pregnancy?
Which among the following is a tensor of vocal cord?

A 18-year-old male patient visits the dermatology clinic with complaints of itchy lesions on his skin. Upon examination, the patient's tongue is noted to be red and beefy with the findings on skin as shown below. Which of the following additional medical histories would you like to inquire about or elicit from this alcoholic patient to aid in diagnosing the cause of his skin lesions and tongue condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Ask for diarrhea and history of memory loss

options.label: B
options.text: ﻿﻿﻿Ask for diarrhea, thiamine deficiency features, and detailed dietary history

questions.correct_answer: A. Ask for diarrhea and history of memory loss
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Ask for diarrhea and history of memory loss

questions.text: A pregnant woman presents with vulval warts. What is the ideal treatment?
A patient who was diagnosed with ADPKD was prescribed tolvaptan. After a few weeks, he presented with dry mouth and increased thirst. What is the likely cause?
A 28-year-old primigravida is suspected to have a baby with down syndrome. In which trimester, quadruple test is done for antenatal screening of Down’s syndrome?

A 5-year-old boy is brought to the pediatrician with complaints of easy fatigability, irritability, and an inability to concentrate. Concerned about the symptoms, the pediatrician orders several laboratory tests, including a bone marrow aspiration. The bone marrow aspiration reveals specific findings as shown in figure A and B (under oil immersion). Based on these findings, which enzyme deficiency is most likely to be responsible for the boy's condition?
Which of the following sites is commonly used for intraoperative core body temperature monitoring?
A newborn is suspected to have truncus arteriosus. According to which classification, truncus arteriosus is divided into four types?

A 55-year-old patient with a history of diabetes presented to the endocrinology clinic with concerns about uncontrolled blood sugar levels. The patient reports that despite taking his prescribed insulin, he was experiencing episodes of hyperglycemia and increased hunger. Upon further evaluation, it is found that the patient's insulin-to-glucagon ratio is decreased. In response to this change in the ratio, which enzyme is activated as part of the body's physiological response?

A 45-year-old male with Ischemic heart disease is posted for Coronary artery bypass graft surgery. You want beat to beat blood pressure measurement intraoperatively to guide you through the hemodynamic changes. Which among the following is the ideal artery for invasive blood pressure measurement ?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Radial

References:

  • ↳ Reference : Morgan and Mikhail’s Clinical Anesthesiology 7 th edition, page 155

questions.text: A 14 weeks old baby was brought to OPD for a routine vaccination. In evening, the baby had a seizure episode. Which vaccine could have been responsible for this event?

A known case of hypertension, which is well controlled on tablet Telimsartan for the past 7 years, is posted for elective laparoscopic appendicectomy. He is placed under which American Society of Anaesthesiologists (ASA) grading?
A 60-year-old female presents with a breast condition as demonstrated in the image below. This condition is due to invasion of?

A 12 years-old child presents with fever and cervical lymphadenopathy. Oral examination shows a grey membrane on the right tonsil extending to the anterior pillar. Which of the following medium will be ideal for the culture of the throat swab for a rapid identification of the pathogen?
Following are the various investigations pertaining to various ear disorders. Identify them in sequence.

options.label: A
options.text: Otosclerosis, Acoustic neuroma, Noise induced hearing loss, Meniere’s disease

options.label: B
options.text: Noise induced hearing loss, Meniere’s disease, Otosclerosis, Acoustic neuroma

options.label: C
options.text: Noise induced hearing loss, Meniere’s disease, Acoustic neuroma, Otosclerosis

options.label: D
options.text: Otosclerosis, Meniere’s disease, Acoustic neuroma, Noise induced hearing loss

questions.correct_answer: C. Noise induced hearing loss, Meniere’s disease, Acoustic neuroma, Otosclerosis
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Noise induced hearing loss, Meniere’s disease, Acoustic neuroma, Otosclerosis

questions.text: A 30-year-old man presents with history of fever with bloody diarrhea 2 weeks back followed by swollen, red & erythematous joints. What is the likely cause?
In reference to the provided box-whisker plot, which statement is correct?

A 20-years-old male patient was admitted to the ICU. He was diagnosed with COVID-19 disease and had symptoms of respiratory distress, high grade fever, cough and weakness. On examination, his Respiratory rate was 28 breaths per minute. On auscultation, crackles were heard over the bilateral lower lung fields. His X-ray chest was ordered which is shown below. Which of the following statements regarding the management of this disease is NOT true?

options.label: A
options.text: High volume ventilation is found to be beneficial for the patient

options.label: B
options.text: A PEEP of 3-5 cm of H2O is recommended for the recruitment of the alveoli

options.label: C
options.text: Surfactant therapy and High frequency jet ventilation have no role in management of ARDS

options.label: D
options.text: Limited fluids and diuretics are indicated to maintain normal Left atrial pressure

questions.correct_answer: B. A PEEP of 3-5 cm of H2O is recommended for the recruitment of the alveoli
questions.explanation: Ans. B. A PEEP of 3-5 cm of H2O is recommended for the recruitment of the alveoli

questions.text: Which layer is responsible for preserving the cornea's hydration and transparency among the options provided?
A 15-year-old boy complains of multiple episodes of acute severe pain in his fingers and toes which resolves on its own for the past 1 year. What could be the likely diagnosis?

A 30-year-old ingests a large amount of acetaminophen and 12 hours later develops malaise and abdominal pain. Laboratory studies show an elevated ALT. N-acetylcysteine is administered to aid in generation of which of the following molecules within cells as a protective mechanism to reduce the number of free radicals?

A 50-year-old male patient presents to the hospital for a follow-up after undergoing a total thyroidectomy. He reports experiencing perioral numbness that started three days after the surgery. Upon further investigation, the patient has no history of nerve damage, facial trauma, or dental procedures. What diagnostic tests should be conducted to determine the cause of the perioral numbness?
questions.correct_answer: D. Calcium, Phosphate and Parathormone levels
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Calcium, Phosphate and Parathormone levels

questions.text: Which of the following manifestations is NOT correctly paired with its aetiology?

A 25-year-old patient presents to the ophthalmology clinic with complaints of blurred vision and difficulty focusing on distant objects. Upon examination, the ophthalmologist diagnoses the patient with simple myopic astigmatism. Which of the following would be prescribed for simple myopic astigmatism?
Which of the following situations does not require immediate management?

options.label: A
options.text: A road traffic accident patient with bilateral nose block and soft, fluctuant swelling

options.label: B
options.text: A completely normal young patient having sudden onset of complete hearing loss and tinnitus on one side

options.label: C
options.text: An elderly male with incontrollable nasal bleed

options.label: D
options.text: A road traffic accident patient with swelling on dorsum of nose and fracture nasal bones

questions.correct_answer: D. A road traffic accident patient with swelling on dorsum of nose and fracture nasal bones
questions.explanation: Ans. D. A road traffic accident patient with swelling on dorsum of nose and fracture nasal bones

questions.text: A 45-year-old male patient presents to the ophthalmology clinic with complaints of drooping of the upper eyelid in his right eye. He reports a gradual onset of this condition over the past few weeks, along with other symptoms like decreased sweating on the right side of his face and a constricted pupil in the same eye. Upon further examination, the ophthalmologist suspects Horner's syndrome. What can be the preferred management for ptosis for this patient?

A middle-aged man 45-year-old man presents with increasing abdominal girth and yellow discoloration of his skin and sclera. He had hepatomegaly and jaundice on physical examination. A Prussian blue stain of a liver biopsy is shown in the image. What is the major intracellular iron storage protein in this patient’s hepatocytes?
Which of the following statements accurately reflects the provisions of the Factories Act?

options.label: A
options.text: Children under 14 years of age must not be employed in factories

options.label: B
options.text: A child of 16 years can be employed only between 6 AM and 8 PM

options.label: C
options.text: The maximum working hours for an adult is 72 hours per week

options.label: D
options.text: A child of 16 years can work till 5 hours per day

questions.correct_answer: A. Children under 14 years of age must not be employed in factories
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Children under 14 years of age must not be employed in factories

questions.text: A 35-year-old female presents with multiple swellings in her right lower limb, which disappear when she lies down. Multiple varicosities are noted, along with pitting oedema of calf. What is the C stage according to CEAP?

A 1-year-old boy had complaints of recurrent fever. He had been treated for severe pneumonia 3 weeks back. Clinical examination revealed mild pallor, oral thrush, micrognathia, low-set right ear. Skin examination was remarkable with patchy hypopigmentation around face, trunk, back, abdomen, perianal region, hands and feet along with hypopigmented silver gray hair. Peripheral smear showed abnormal inclusions as shown in the given image. Identify the defect associated with this condition.
A young patient with RTA sustained open fracture of femur which was operated & stabilized as shown below. Identify the fixator.
Which view is best for visualising which sinus. Match accordingly.

A 52-year-old patient with a history of chronic alcohol abuse presents to the clinic with complaints of oral ulcers and a burning sensation in the mouth. A picture of the patient's oral cavity is provided, which reveals several white patches on the tongue and inner cheek. Based on this presentation, what is the likely diagnosis for this patient?
According to the recommended dietary allowance in India, what is the appropriate daily dose of iodine for lactating women?
Tall tented T waves are seen in which electrolyte abnormality?

A 2 years old child is brought to the emergency with history of fever and vomiting. On examination he has neck rigidity. options.label: B
options.text: It is used for skewed distributions

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: B. It is used for skewed distributions
questions.explanation: Ans. B. It is used for skewed distributions

Clinical examination reveals normal spleen. Her lab investigations show low platelet count and peripheral smear shows megakaryocytes. Which of the following is the best treatment for this condition?

A 10-year-old boy is brought to the hospital with symptoms of an inguinal hernia. During the operation, the surgeon observes a segment of necrotic bowel in the hernial sac. What is the appropriate course of action for resection and anastomosis of a necrotic bowel seen during surgery?

options.label: A
options.text: The surgeon must use chromic catgut.

options.label: B
options.text: The surgeon must not include the submucosa in the sutures.

options.label: C
options.text: The surgeon must use the single layer, extra-mucosal suture technique.

options.label: D
options.text: The surgeon must use the single- layer seromuscular suture technique.

questions.correct_answer: C. The surgeon must use the single layer, extra-mucosal suture technique.
questions.explanation: Ans. C. The surgeon must use the single layer, extra-mucosal suture technique.

questions.text: A surgery resident, on rotation at a hospital, is tasked with inserting an intercostal drainage tube in a 65-year-old patient with a history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) who was admitted with a severe exacerbation of their symptoms. options.text: Inserted tube along the lower border of upper rib
